content: Judgment Must Come
Then the LORD said to me, “ if Moses and Samuel were to stand before Me, My heart would not be with this people. Send them away from My presence and have them go!
And it shall be that when they say to you, ‘Where should we go?’ then you are to tell them, ‘This is what the LORD says:
“Those  for death, to death;
And those  for the sword, to the sword;
And those  for famine, to famine;
And those  for captivity, to captivity.”’
And I will appoint over them four kinds ,” declares the LORD: “the sword to kill, the dogs to drag away, and the birds of the sky and the animals of the earth to devour and destroy.
I will make them an object of terror among all the kingdoms of the earth because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, the king of Judah, for what he did in Jerusalem.
“Indeed, who will have pity on you, Jerusalem,
Or who will mourn for you,
Or who will turn aside to ask about your welfare?
You who have forsaken Me,” declares the ,
“You keep going backward.
So I will stretch out My hand against you and destroy you;
I am tired of relenting!
I will winnow them with a winnowing fork
At the gates of the land;
I will bereave  of children, I will destroy My people;
They did not repent of their ways.
Their widows will be more numerous before Me
Than the sand of the seas;
I will bring against them, against the mother of a young man,
A destroyer at noon;
I will suddenly bring down on her
Shock and horror.
She who gave birth to seven  withers away;
Her breathing is labored.
Her sun has set while it was still day;
She has been shamed and humiliated.
So I will turn over their survivors to the sword
Before their enemies,” declares the .
Jeremiah’s Prayer and God’s Answer
You know, ;
Remember me, take notice of me,
And take vengeance for me on my persecutors.
Do not, in view of Your patience, take me away;
Know that for Your sake I endure reproach.
Your words were found and I ate them,
And Your words became a joy to me and the delight of my heart;
For I have been called by Your name,
God of armies.
I did not sit in a circle of revelers and celebrate.
Because of Your hand  I sat alone,
For You filled me with indignation.
Why has my pain been endless
And my wound incurable, refusing to be healed?
Will You indeed be to me like a deceptive
With water that is unreliable?
